column5: I had a guide trip on lake Simcoe today and man was it a hot one out there... especially with hardly any wind.  That did not seem to bother the big smallies as they were cruising on all my spots I hit today.  At one point we had 4 big smallies cruising under the shade of the boat!  We got some real giants today and the key to getting them to hit was really long casts away from the boat as the big fish spook and will not hit near the boat.  Here is a sample of the kind of tanks that hit today!    Be safe and Good Fish'n.... Greg.
Neeeeice!  Thats a fatty smalljaw?  Thanks for the pics and report!  Miigwich
Man that's a monster .congrats...thanks for sharing

That sure is a big Piggy you have there. Look at how dark it is. We were out today actually all afternoon, we didn't get on the water until 13:30. It was hot. When we docked some one said it was too hot to fish. I pointed at US Steel plant across the creek and said " now that's hot."
Wow, what a tank!  I've been catching similar fish at long point trolling scatter raps.. none that size tho...  Were you out by the islands?  Cheers Mate!
Great day on the water.....Thanks for sharing
heading out smallie fishing on GB this weekend but my experience is minimal in really warm weather...what depth were you focusing on?

Wow, what a tank!  I've been catching similar fish at long point trolling scatter raps.. none that size tho...  Were you out by the islands?  Cheers Mate!  I was fishing humps and rock shoals on the East side of the lake 6 to 12ft.
